Description: While selective CDK4/6 inhibitors have transformed the armamentarium of ER+ breast cancer, these agents remain investigational in other cancer types.  This session will demonstrate the potential for selective CDK4/6 inhibition outside of ER+ breast cancer and will highlight mechanism-based progress.  First, CDK4/6 inhibitors remain of high interest in liposarcoma, characterized by CDK4 amplification, where predictive and pharmacodynamic biomarkers of senescence are relevant to clinical outcomes and are important considerations in an ongoing randomized trial in de-differentiated disease. Second, understanding of the impact of these agents on the immune microenvironment continues to evolve, with recent data indicating effects not only on T-cell activation but also on immune memory, carrying implications for safely optimizing combinations with immune checkpoint blockade in melanoma and beyond.  Finally, CDK4/6 inhibitors are promising combinatorial partners with inhibitors of signal transduction, with multiple preclinical studies now translating to clinical trials in a variety of tumor types.
Location: Room 6 DE - Upper Level - Convention Center

Title: CDK4/6 Inhibitors: Not Just for Breast Cancer Anymore
